replyContent: Thank you for your review. The feature to switch profiles in the NHS App to act on behalf of another person, such as a child or dependant, is currently available at GP surgeries that use either the SystmOne (TPP) or Patient Access (EMIS) systems. Access is controlled by the GP surgery. You can ask them to register you for proxy access.

content: START OF PS. Update 15/09/2020. I started with a new email address to unblock the system. With more persistence, I think I now know the problem. If you do not wear spectacles on your passport photograph but you do on your scans or webcams, you will be rejected on each occasion. But we have a circular problem here: if you do not wear your spectacles then you may not be able to read the on-screen instructions, e.g. "move a little closer". It is necessary to call for some help (not easy during these COVID-19 times), takeoff your spectacles and get someone to read the on-screen instructions to. Clearly, people with good eyesight designed the system. END OF PS I have used my mobile phone and a computer with various cameras to seek verification. Five times my submissions have been declined. What is wrong with this system? Why does it not offer alternatives when verification submissions are declined?

We suggest contacting the surgery to see if they have any other appointments that are not currently bookable using the NHS App.
